description:
Having lost his wife, math teacher Kouhei Inuzuka is doing his best to raise his young daughter Tsumugi as a single father. He's pretty bad at cooking and doesn't have a huge appetite to begin with, but chance brings his little family and one of his students, Kotori Iida, together for homemade adventures. With those three cooks in the kitchen, it's no wonder this dinner table drama is so delicious.

(Source: Kodansha USA)

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

node.description:
**Founded:** 2013
**Disbanded:** 2017

**[Website](http://www.mimimememimi.com/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimimeme_MIMI)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/takaoyuki/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mimimemeMIMIchannel/videos)**

**Biography:**
MimimemeMIMI was a Japanese music unit which consisted of now retired voice actress (seiyuu) and vocalist/lyricist Takao Yuki (タカオユキ) and illustrator Chamooi. The duo debuted with a song titled "Sentimental Love", which was used as the opening theme song to the anime *[A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741/Kimi-no-Iru-Machi/)*. The girls called themselves a "next generation audio-visual unit" and offered a unique mixture of music and imagery. The unit name, "Mimi Meme Mimi", was made under the wish that they wanted their songs to appeal to their listeners "From ears to eyes. From eyes to ears" (耳・目・目・耳 *Mimi-Me-Me-Mimi*)

**Members:**
- [Takao Yuki (タカオユキ)](https://anilist.co/staff/119709/Yuki-Takao) - vocals, lyrics
- Chamooi (ちゃもーい) - illustrations

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mimi_Meme_Mimi), edited)
